Description: Malicious insider exfiltrates proprietary source code, trade secrets, or designs
Unauthorized access or disclosure of customer PII/PHI resulting in regulatory breach
Employees paste sensitive data into unapproved SaaS/GenAI tools without realizing data leaves control
Non-malicious disclosure via misconfiguration, oversharing, or misdirected communication
Sysadmins or DBAs access sensitive data without business need or authorization
Former employees or contractors retain active accounts after departure
Single individual can both execute AND approve high-risk transactions
Disgruntled employee intentionally damages systems or data as retaliation
Failure to meet NIS2, DORA, or GDPR requirements for insider risk controls
Contractors, vendors, or MSPs misuse access to client systems or data
